aroma.notes: Vanilla scent with a hint of fruit.

acidity.notes: More complex fruit, can't put my finger on it. A dried fruit like a raisin makes sense because of the natural sugary taste. I can definitely 'feel' it on the sides on my tongue.

sweetness.notes: Definitely a bit more '3D'. If the acidic quality is grape, then this is making it more like a raisin.

body.notes: Tea-like to light syrup. I wouldn't mind more of it.

finish.notes: Left with warm, slightly tea-like aftertaste. Pleasant.

flavor: Smooth but non-descript for the first two seconds, then suddenly the raisin note blooms in my mouth. On swallow I feel the tea-like finish. Through the cup, the raisin note builds up to where it tastes more sour. On cooldown everything except the sour quality tends to disappear. Overall better balanced but still one note is screaming for attention.
observations: Only variable that changed was that I increased bloom swirl time to 8 seconds, e.g. 'ONE, TWO... NINE!'
actionItem: Keep the same bloom swirl but decrease grind size to 23.
